getChangeStatistic

public abstract ITraitStatistic getChangeStatistic()

hasCompleteDuration

public java.lang.Boolean hasCompleteDuration()
Description copied from interface: ITrait
Returns true if the trait has zero adoptees and has been "lost" from the population, and thus a total duration can be calculated. If this returns false for a given trait, the caller should assume that the trait has a non-zero adoption count and thus is still "in play" within the population, so asking for its duration would skew any statistics.

Specified by:
hasCompleteDuration in interface ITrait

getTraitDuration

public java.lang.Integer getTraitDuration()
Description copied from interface: ITrait
Returns the number of model ticks (copying events in Moran-style models, or N * tick copying events in WF models) the trait persisted in the population at non-zero adoption levels before the adoption count first hit zero.

Specified by:
getTraitDuration in interface ITrait
Returns:
number of model ticks the trait persisted in the population before being lost
